message.content: This question tests knowledge about pollution and its effects. Pollution refers to the presence of harmful substances or contaminants in the environment that can cause harm to living organisms. Throwing a gum wrapper in the ocean is an example of pollution because it introduces a non-biodegradable waste into the ocean, which can harm marine life and disrupt the ecosystem. Options (A), (B), and (C) are unrelated to pollution.

This question requires an understanding of what pollution is. Pollution refers to the presence of harmful substances in the environment, usually caused by human activities. Option (D) is correct because throwing a gum wrapper in the ocean would contribute to pollution by adding waste to the water. Option (A) is incorrect because fish swimming in the sea is a natural occurrence and not the definition of pollution. Option (B) is incorrect because the wind carrying seeds is a natural process and not directly related to pollution. Option (C) is incorrect because trees in a forest are also a natural occurrence and not the definition of pollution.

This question requires basic knowledge about pollution and its effects on the environment. Pollution refers to the release of harmful substances into the environment, which can have negative impacts on ecosystems and organisms. Option (D) is the correct answer as throwing a gum wrapper in the ocean is an example of littering and polluting the ocean. Option (A) is incorrect because fish swimming in the sea is a natural occurrence and not directly related to pollution. Option (B) is incorrect because the wind carrying seeds is a natural process in seed dispersal and not related to pollution. Option (C) is incorrect because trees in a forest are part of the natural ecosystem and are not directly related to pollution.

This question tests knowledge about the concept of pollution. Pollution refers to the presence of harmful substances in the environment that can negatively impact living organisms. Option (D) is the correct answer because throwing a gum wrapper in the ocean is an action that pollutes the environment and can harm marine life. Options (A), (B), and (C) are incorrect because they are examples of natural processes or elements of the environment that are not directly related to pollution.

This question requires knowledge about the definition and examples of pollution. Pollution refers to the harmful substances or contaminants that are introduced into the environment, often causing damage to ecosystems and human health. Option (D) is the correct answer because throwing a gum wrapper in the ocean is an example of pollution, as it introduces waste into the ocean, causing harm to marine life and the overall ecosystem. Options (A), (B), and (C) are all unrelated to pollution and do not involve harmful substances being introduced into the environment.

Options (A), (B), and (C) are incorrect because they do not describe pollution.
